program agc033a

   implicit none

   integer :: H, W, ans =0, i, j, di, current_depth, ny, nx, current_y, current_x
   integer, dimension(4) :: dx, dy
   integer, allocatable :: flag(:,:), front, rear
   type queue_node
      integer :: y, x, depth
   end type queue_node
   type(queue_node), allocatable :: queue(:)
   character(len=1), allocatable :: A(:,:)
   character(len=200) :: row_str ' assuming W is less than 200.'

   ! Read H and W:
   read(*,*) H, W
   allocate( A(H,W), stat = ierr) ' '

children.text:
Read grid A
   allocate( queue(H*W) ) front =1
   rear =0
   do i=1,H
       read *, row_str
       do j=1,W
           A(i,j) = row_str(j:j)
           if (A(i,j) == '#') then
               rear = rear +1
               queue(rear)%y =i
               queue(rear)%x =j
               queue(rear)%depth =0
           end if
       end do
   end do

   ! BFS 
   do while (front <= rear)
       type(queue_node) :: current = queue(front)
       front = front +1
       current_y = current%y
       current_x = current%x
       current_depth = current%depth

       do di =1,4
           ny = current_y + dy(di)
           nx = current_x + dx(di)
           if ( ny >=1 .and. ny <= H .and. nx >=1 .and. nx <= W) then
               if (flag(ny,nx) ==0 .and. A(ny,nx) == '.' ) then
                   flag(ny,nx) =1
                   rear = rear +1
                   queue(rear)%y = ny
                   queue(rear)%x = nx
                   queue(rear)%depth = current_depth +1
                   ans = current_depth +1
               end if
           end if
       end do
   end do
   print *, ans

end program agc033a Wait but I need to check for the row_str's length. Wait row_str should be at least W characters. So in code, when reading row_str, we need to read a string with length exactly W. Alternatively, using a format to read precisely, but perhaps with the following:

Structure of the Fortran Code:

program agc033a

   implicit none

   integer :: H, W, ans =0, i, j, di, current_depth, ny, nx, current_y, current_x
   integer, dimension(4) :: dx, dy
   integer, allocatable :: flag(:,:), front, rear
   type queue_node
      integer :: y, x, depth
   end type queue_node
   type(queue_node), allocatable :: queue(:)
   character(len=1), allocatable :: A(:,:)
   character(len=200) :: row_str ' assuming W is less than 200.'

   ! Read H and W:
   read(*,*) H, W
   allocate( A(H,W), stat = ierr) ' ' need to handle errors but maybe assume no
   allocate( flag(H,W) )
   dx = [1, -1, 0, 0]
   dy = [0,0,1, -1]
   flag =0 
   ! Read grid A
   allocate( queue(H*W) )
   front =1
   rear =0
   do i=1,H
       read *, row_str
       do j=1,W
           A(i,j) = row_str(j:j)
           if (A(i,j) == '#') then
               rear = rear +1
               queue(rear)%y =i
               queue(rear)%x =j
               queue(rear)%depth =0
           end if
       end do
   end do

   ! BFS 
   do while (front <= rear)
       type(queue_node) :: current = queue(front)
       front = front +1
       current_y = current%y
       current_x = current%x
       current_depth = current%depth

       do di =1,4
           ny = current_y + dy(di)
           nx = current_x + dx(di)
           if ( ny >=1 .and. ny <= H .and. nx >=1 .and. nx <= W) then
               if (flag(ny,nx) ==0 .and. A(ny,nx) == '.' ) then
                   flag(ny,nx) =1
                   rear = rear +1
                   queue(rear)%y = ny
                   queue(rear)%x = nx
                   queue(rear)%depth = current_depth +1
                   ans = current_depth +1
               end if
           end if
       end do
   end do
   print *, ans

end program agc033a

But in the code, in the loop over j=1 to W, it will process correctly up to W characters.

Thus, the code with this correction is:

program agc033a

   implicit none

   integer :: H, W, ans =0, i, j, di, current_depth, ny, nx, current_y, current_x
   integer, dimension(4) :: dx, dy
   integer, allocatable :: flag(:,:), front, rear
   type queue_node
     integer :: y, x, depth
   end type queue_node
   type(queue_node), allocatable :: queue(:)
   character(len=1), allocatable :: A(:,:)
   character(len=2000) :: row_str

   ! Read H and W:
   read(*,*) H, W
   allocate( A(H,W) )
   allocate( flag(H,W) )
   dx = [1, -1, 0, 0]
   dy = [0,0,1, -1]
   flag =0 

   ! Read grid into A
   allocate( queue(H*W) )
   front =1
   rear =0
   do i=1,H
       read(*,'(A)') row_str
       do j=1,W
           A(i,j) = row_str(j:j)
           if (A(i,j) == '#') then
               rear = rear +1
               queue(rear)%y =i
               queue(rear)%x =j
               queue(rear)%depth =0
           end if
       end do
   end do

   ! BFS 
   do while (front <= rear)
       type(queue_node) :: current = queue(front)
       front = front +1
       current_y = current%y
       current_x = current%x
       current_depth = current%depth

       do di =1,4
           ny = current_y + dy(di)
           nx = current_x + dx(di)
           if ( ny >=1 .and. ny <= H .and. nx >=1 .and. nx <= W ) then
               if (flag(ny,nx) ==0 .and. A(ny,nx) == '.' ) then
                   flag(ny,nx) =1
                   rear = rear +1
                   queue(rear)%y = ny
                   queue(rear)%x = nx
                   queue(rear)%depth = current_depth +1
                   ans = current_depth +1
               end if
           end if
       end do
   end do
   print *, ans

end program agc033a
